article:
A 'marginal abatement cost curve' or 'MAC curve' is a set of options available
to an economy to reduce pollution. They are valuable tools in understanding
emissions trading, driving forecasts of carbon allowance prices, prioritizing
investment opportunities, and shaping policy discussions.

Typically, MAC curves cover emissions reduction opportunities across a number of
sectors in an economy including power, industry, waste, buildings, transport,
agriculture, and forestry.
